question:
A shopkeeper allows three types of successive discounts as
(i) 35% and 5%, (ii) 30% and 10%, (iii) 25% and 15%
Which discount is the best for a purchaser?
explanation:
(i) Equivalent discount
$latex = \\left ( 35+5-\\frac{35\\times 5}{100} \\right )\\%&s=1$
$latex = 40-1.75 = 38.25%$
(ii) Equivalent discount
$latex = \\left ( 30+10-\\frac{30\\times 10}{100} \\right )\\%&s=1$
$latex = 40-3 = 37%$
(iii) Equivalent discount
$latex = \\left ( 25+15-\\frac{25\\times 15}{100} \\right )\\%&s=1$
$latex = 40-3.75 = 36.25%$
Now we can easily say that first discount is best.
Hence option [A] is our answer.
